channel.title: Decompiling the clients
channel.description:
So I tried decompiling some RSC private server clients. They had no obfuscation. I used DJ Java decompiler(which is based on JAD), also tried JAD by itself alone. They managed to decompile it, but with errors.
[code]Parsing mudclient.class...Parsing inner class mudclient$1.class... Generating mudclient.java Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method handleIncomingPacket Couldn't resolve all exception handlers in method getServerStatus[/code]
For example this. I even tried with a client that I had source for that eliminate the obfuscation possibility. Same thing.
Any suggestions on decompilers? JODE totally fucked up itself.

item.title: Decompiling the clients
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

I have the raw client’s src files, except it needs the mina and xstream class files with it which that didn’t come, so i tried to download a few different versions of mina/xstream and they just were not clinging. Even decompiled xstream/mina from rscd’s client, fixed some errors and tried using them, unfortunately it did not work.

Read full topic

item.title: Decompiling the clients
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Fix the errors manually and you may get it running.

Read full topic
